label: non-argumentative

label: non-argumentative

text: Article 125 of the Turkish Constitution provides as follows:
label: non-argumentative

text: All acts or decisions of the Administration are subject to judicial review ...
label: non-argumentative

text: The Administration shall be liable for damage caused by its own acts and measures.
label: non-argumentative

text: This provision is not subject to any restrictions even in a state of emergency or war.
label: non-argumentative

text: The latter requirement of the provision does not necessarily require proof of the existence of any fault on the part of the Administration, whose liability is of an absolute, objective nature, based on a theory of "social risk".
label: non-argumentative

text: Thus the Administration may indemnify people who have suffered damage from acts committed by unidentified persons when the State may be said to have failed in its duty to safeguard individual life and property.

label: non-argumentative
